image.altText: Shop front of a disability employment provider office

props.synopsis: A national disability employment provider, which supports more than 6,000 Australians living with a disability, has lost federal funding, ABC News understands.

title.children: Major disability employment provider tells staff it has lost federal funding

image.altText: A sign outside disability support service Bedford.

props.synopsis: Bedford is hoping the federal government will throw it a financial lifeline to avoid it entering voluntary administration, but the government says it does not usually put taxpayer money into a "failing organisation".

title.children: Disability employment provider Bedford hoping for a lifeline

image.altText: A line of large trucks carrying hay bales travel down the Eyre Highway

props.synopsis: More than 80 trucks loaded with more than 6,000 bales of hay and straw from WA is heading for drought-stricken parts of South Australia.

title.children: WA's farming community rallies to help drought-hit SA

image.altText: An aerial view showing land with trees and the ocean.

props.synopsis: The plant planned for the outskirts of Port Lincoln was due to cost $330 million, but has now increased by $140 million due to "global inflationary pressures" and a design change.

title.children: Cost of Eyre Peninsula desalination plant blows out by $140m

image.altText: A farmer welcomes the rain looking up with his arms outstretched and palms facing up to capture the rain.

props.synopsis: A wave of wintry weather is causing downpours across SA, but the heavens were not the only things to open — Loxton grain farmer Robin Schaefer extended his arms in gratitude as he looked skywards.

title.children: Rain lifting 'everyone's spirits' as wintry weather sweeps across SA

image.altText: Jordan Dawson holds his arms out to his side with another man placing a hand on his head and shoulder

props.synopsis: Adelaide has soared into premiership contention as one of the in-form teams late in the AFL season. Winning seven of their last eight games, the Crows are perfectly placed for a September charge.

title.children: Adelaide signals its arrival as a genuine AFL premiership contender

image.altText: A photo taken from a plane window shows a thin river with lots of twists and turns, and native vegetation on the bank.

props.synopsis: Thirteen years since the start of the Murray-Darling Basin Plan, a comprehensive evaluation finds rivers, wetlands and lakes are in far better shape.

title.children: Positive report card for Murray-Darling Basin Plan, but not all agree

image.altText: A red Bendigo Bank sign.

props.synopsis: Bendigo Bank announces it will be shutting down its agency model that allowed customers to access banking services from smaller locations such as newsagencies, citing "decreasing customer use" as a factor.

title.children: Bendigo Bank to close 28 agency locations due to decreasing use

image.altText: A man stands in the foreground with a picture of another man on a screen in the background.

props.synopsis: SA Police has provided updates on their separate searches for the remains of suspected murder victims Julian Story, whose body was found last month, and Melissa Trussell, who disappeared 25 years ago.

title.children: Police search for Julian Story's remains called off, cold case search continues

image.altText: Shorthead seahorses found washed up at Hallett Cove.

props.synopsis: An independent group of marine scientists from around Australia releases a seven-point plan to tackle what it describes as South Australia's "catastrophic" toxic algal bloom.

title.children: Seven steps scientists say will tackle toxic algal bloom

image.altText: Hulk Hogan, wearing a bandana and singlet, speaks with a microphone.

props.synopsis: Hogan is widely credited with transforming America's wrestling scene into a family entertainment spectacle. But his private life and political views courted controversy in his later years.

title.children: Hulk Hogan, wrestling superstar whose private life made headlines, dies at 71

image.altText: A beekeeper holds a comb in his hand covered in bees.

props.synopsis: South Australian beekeepers are already battling drought and low prices. The last thing they need is a bee-killing parasite, which has stayed out of the state so far.

title.children: Beehive movement under scrutiny as SA tries to remain varroa mite free

image.altText: Aerial view of highway with a few residences pictured on the ground.

props.synopsis: A tourism business has lodged an appeal against a decision to approve a nearly billion-dollar energy storage project outside Broken Hill, saying light and noise will impact its business.

title.children: Outback stargazing business fights approval of $1b energy project

image.altText: An illustration of a hot pink bill with blue and black liquid pouring out

props.synopsis: Australia's pharmaceuticals watchdog is investigating a spike in adverse event reports for Vyvanse, the country's most commonly prescribed ADHD medication.

title.children: Australia's most common ADHD drug has had a spike in adverse event reports

image.altText: Aerial shot of a beach in Phuket, Thailand with tourists swimming in the water and sunbathing

props.synopsis: Staff at a hotel in Phuket, Thailand, found the body of an Australian man in his room, with authorities saying he was still on a call when he died.

title.children: Young Australian man found dead in Phuket hotel room

image.altText: A man in a suit points at the camera

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump has celebrated Australia's decision to lift biosecurity import restrictions on US beef, saying his country will "sell so much" beef to Australia.

title.children: Donald Trump says he wants to 'sell so much' beef to Australia — as it happened

image.altText: two female students carrying handbags walk through a university campus. they are facing away from the camera

props.synopsis: Those who paid off their student loans quickly before indexation rose may regret that decision, now that HECS-HELP debts are set to be slashed by 20 per cent.

title.children: Student debt regret: What it means for those who have paid off HECS

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The ASX has ended the week in the red after a day of losses. See how the day's events and insights unfolded on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX falls, as mining and gold stocks weigh on share market — as it happened

image.altText: A film still showing a man wearing a blue superhero suit and white gloves and a 4 on his chest in front of a wall of flames

props.synopsis: Marvel's first family is back on the big screen with a retro aesthetic, a star-studded cast and a hunger to wipe the superhero movie slate clean.

title.children: Fantastic Four fails to make Pedro Pascal a traditional movie star

image.altText: Science lab

props.synopsis: The solution to Australia's productivity problem could be more investment in research and development, and a new tax on big business might be one way to achieve that.

title.children: Calls to tax big businesses that don't invest in new technology

props.synopsis: The bloodiest military battles in more than a decade between Thailand and Cambodia have reportedly killed at least 16 people — mostly civilians.

title.children: Thailand-Cambodia military exchanges could lead to war, acting Thai PM says

image.altText: triple j's Abby & Tyrone wearing Hottest 100 of Australian songs merch laughing together

props.synopsis: This Saturday, we find out what Australia considers to be the Hottest 100 of Australian Songs. Here's everything you need to know.

title.children: Your guide to the Hottest 100 of Australian Songs

image.altText: Alex de Minaur stands with legs spread wide apart on court, after hitting a forehand return from the baseline.

props.synopsis: Australian number one Alex de Minaur is through to his first quarterfinal since April following a hard-earned three-set win over Jiri Lehecka at the Washington Open.

title.children: Alex de Minaur battles to reach DC Open QF, matches Alcaraz feat

image.altText: TS dancers

props.synopsis: The International Court of Justice declared that states do have a "duty to cooperate" on addressing climate change or they risk breaching international law. It raises the question — will the Australian government heed the warning?

title.children: Climate ruling puts Australia on notice, but is Canberra listening?

image.altText: Ben O'Connor on Tour de France podium after stage 18.

props.synopsis: Having long considered the Tour de France a relentless and unforgiving challenge, Ben O'Connor roars back with a stunning stage 18 victory in the Alps to finally bury memories of the crashes he has suffered in recent years.

title.children: Aussie O'Connor tames 'cruel race' to win Tour de France stage

image.altText: Psychologist holds a teenage girl's hands while balancing a clipboard on her lap.

props.synopsis: Patients and health experts say psychological screening prior to bariatric surgery may help identify people with eating disorders, and counter potential mental health impacts of the life-changing procedure.

title.children: Bariatric surgery patients at risk of eating disorders, calls for psychological screenings

image.altText: A Tibetan man shows a framed portrait of the 11th Panchen Lama, Gedhun Choekyi Nyima.

props.synopsis: China's communist authorities forcibly disappeared the boy chosen to play a major role in the succession of the Dalai Lama, and 30 years on, Tibetan Buddhists continue to resist their attempt to take control.

title.children: Person who would pick next Dalai Lama has been missing for 30 years

image.altText: A camera on board a satellite looks down towards Earth showing part of the satellite and the planet.

props.synopsis: Starlink is said to have 200,000 users in Australia and 6 million globally.

title.children: Elon Musk's Starlink global outage caused by software failure

image.altText: An artist's impression of flightless birds being attacked by a predator from above.

props.synopsis: A US biotech company that claimed to "de-extinct" dire wolves has set its sights on bringing back the moa, a large, flightless bird that once inhabited New Zealand.

title.children: Bid to 'de-extinct' large, flightless bird that once roamed New Zealand

image.altText: A moustachioed young man with grey hair speaks to an elderly woman.

props.synopsis: Former star of the screen and stage Henri Szeps has died after a battle with Alzheimer's disease.

title.children: 'Died as he lived': Australian actor Henri Szeps dies aged 81

image.altText: A large crowd of women holding out pots and calling for food.

props.synopsis: A UN agency says it is trying to get more than 6,000 truckloads of aid to Gaza to alleviate mass starvation, as the US announces it is pulling out of ceasefire talks and sending its delegation home.

title.children: UN says 6,000 aid trucks cannot enter Gaza as ceasefire talks stall

image.altText: a man in an orange jumpsuit sits at a desk in a courthouse

props.synopsis: Bryan Kohberger's co-workers, cellmates and former Tinder matches have labelled him "socially awkward" and "annoying" in newly released police documents.

title.children: New documents detail 'socially awkward', 'annoying' Idaho killer

image.altText: Sussan Ley ABC

props.synopsis: The opposition leader faces a diabolical situation with the debate over whether the Coalition should abandon the 2050 net zero target.

title.children: Zero positives for Sussan Ley in the Coalition's net zero battle

image.altText: Max Verstappen in the pit lane, looking on, while wearing a cap

props.synopsis: The three-week break between the British Grand Prix at the start of July to this weekend's race in Belgium has been one of the more chaotic periods in Formula 1's recent history.

title.children: Verstappen rumours intensify, Red Bull's new era and Piastri resumes title fight
